artists.strBiographyEN:
Michael Ehlert Falch (born in Køge, Denmark on 16 September 1956) is a Danish singer, guitarist, author and actor.
Founder of Malurt, a classic rock band in the style of Falch's main source of inspiration at the time, Bruce Springsteen. On May 1, 1980, Springsteen appeared on stage with Malurt to co-perform "Hungry Heart" at Forum, Copenhagen. After 5 successful years with Malurt, Falch went solo in 1985 with equally great success. In the early 90's Malurt reunited, again with success, followed by Falch returning to a his solo career, this time struggling with a growing alcoholism. In recent years, after sorting out his addiction, Falch has been writing and touring with storytelling solo concerts. Father of Mathilde Falch.
